**Title: *Essentials of Longevity* (Chángshēng Zhǐyào Piān)**
*Scripture Name: Essentials of Longevity*
Composed by **Lin Zìrán** of the Southern Song.
One scroll.
Source text: *Canonical Daoist Canon (Zhengtong Daozang)*, **Taixuan (Great Mystery) Section**

**Preface to *Essentials of Longevity***

In my youth, I was afflicted by sorrow, my brush and ink neglected, and I grew weary of worldly tastes. Then, upon reading the *Scripture on Purity and Stillness (Qīngjìng Jīng)*, I awoke to self-examination. Thus, I abandoned my home with a resolute heart, clad in rags and barefoot, wandering and seeking across half the land. As for the practices of *visualizing the kidneys to nurture the heart* and *swallowing saliva to internalize qi*, I tried them all. Yet what lingered in my mind was the matter of *Golden Elixir (Jīndān)*, whose roots I had yet to fathom.

Then, fate unfolded—**Master Lǚ Zhēnrén of Western Shu** appeared before me at the **Yānxīá Dàoyuàn** in Chángtíng. With joy, he entrusted me with the secrets of elixir refinement: the methods of *fire regulation, adding and reducing*, all as clear as the palm of my hand. For years now, I have followed his teachings with reverence!

Seeing how common folk stray into convoluted side paths, ever farther from the Dao, I could not bear to keep these truths hidden. Thus, I expounded in subtle words, setting them down in seven chapters, naming this work *Essentials of Longevity (Chángshēng Zhǐyào)*. May those with sincere intent thereby attain enlightenment!

Written on the **Mid-Autumn Day of the Year *Chúnyóu Gēnxū*** (1250 CE),
By **Huíyáng Zǐ** Lin Zìrán

**Essentials of Longevity**
Narrated by **Huíyáng Zǐ** Lin Zìrán
**Chapter One**

**Essentials of Longevity**
Narrated by **Huíyáng Zǐ** Lin Zìrán
**Chapter One**

I have heard that the **Primordial Dao** lies within the **Hun-tun**—unfathomable by perception, ungraspable by cognition. Listen with the ears and hear with the eyes; see with the eyes and perceive with the ears. Vague and indistinct, dim and obscure, neither form nor image, yet named as **Dao**. The subtlety of the Dao being beyond measure, one must only gaze upward and downward to comprehend it. When aligned with the human body, it fits like matching seals.

Having attained the **mystery within the mystery**, the **subtlety within the subtlety**, I dare not keep it entirely concealed. Thus, from the realm of **Being and Non-Being**, I reveal its roots. The **Receptive (Yīn)** is the undivided black of **Hun-tun**, like the stem of a gourd, containing the true essence. The **black qi** permeates, blending with **Creation**,—is this not the marvel of **Taiyi** embracing the true **qi**?

Once the **Two Principles (Yīn-Yáng)** are distinguished, the **Four Symbols** emerge, and from them, the **Five Phases** manifest. Then the **Eight Trigrams** are arranged, with the **central palace** as their origin. The central palace is the domain of **Earth**. Thus, water finds stability in Earth, fire finds rest, metal finds life, and wood flourishes—like a child in its mother’s womb, nourished by the **primordial black qi** of Heaven and Earth, aligned with the central palace, breathing in unison. Once the embryo forms and the umbilical cord is severed, the received **true black qi** of Heaven and Earth, infused with the **Divine Sovereign’s spirit-qi**, merges with the primordial harmony, enduring as long as Heaven and Earth, sharing in their transformation.

Yet when **emotions and desires** stir within and without, when **pleasures and attachments** arise, the **qi** separates from the true, the **original spirit** follows external allurements. Though it mingles with the **true qi** of Heaven and Earth, without a foundation for **transformation**, it is instead seized by them, causing the body to decay and the **qi** to fade—thus, death becomes inevitable.

This **qi** is the **Primordial Chaos’s ancestral breath**, the **source of immortal life and fate**. To possess it is to live; to lose it is to die. Those who attain it **plunder Heaven and Earth’s creation**; those who fail are **plundered by them**—what is lost is the **single point of original yang-qi**.

Practitioners of cultivation, why not return to the **Root** and refine according to the seasons, forging the **Great Elixir**? The method of refinement is simple: inhale when the **Mother** exhales, exhale when the **Mother** inhales. Each inhalation draws **Heaven’s qi** downward; each exhalation raises **Earth’s qi** upward. Breathing follows its natural rhythm, not blindly forced—stir one spirit, and all spirits move; open one orifice, and all orifices open.

Seekers of the Dao must trace its source, as if still within the **mother’s womb**, embracing the **Primordial**, guarding the **One**. **Taiyi** contains the true **qi**; Heaven and Earth nurture the **Yellow Sprout**. The **Yellow Sprout** is the **mother of Lead**—those who fail to cultivate see their **qi** severed, their life extinguished, unable to **reclaim the lost light** and reflect inward, fixated only on the external.

**Huíyáng Zǐ** says: The **essence of Heaven and Earth** gathers in the **sun and moon**; the **essence of humanity** resides in the **eyes**. When a person takes form, the **kidneys** emerge first, corresponding to the **Wheel of Essence** within. Then the **eyes** form, like water droplets, mirroring Heaven and Earth in their purity. Before Heaven and Earth divided, before the **Two Luminaires** shone, all was **Hun-tun**, dim and obscure. When the **Two Principles** separated, the **Two Luminaires** illuminated, **water and fire** emerged, and all things were born—thus arises the marvel of **transformation**.

To cultivate, one must extract the **Primordial qi** beneath the **horizontal eyes**, seeking the **Heavenly-Earthly essence** and applying it. If this subtlety is mastered, it is called **soaring beyond sun and moon**, piercing the **Kunlun peaks**. Ancestors of the Dao taught no other path.

The **Yellow Court** is the **furnace and cauldron** where sacred deeds are forged, where **divinity** is born. **Pure above, turbid below**, the path connects the **Eight Waters**, ascending to the **Sea of Marrow**, regulating the **Five Qi**, blending the **Hundred Spirits**, descending to the **Gushing Spring**, cycling endlessly day and night. The **true essence of Heaven and Earth**, along with the **spirit without form**, may be united here. When the **ten months** of cultivation are complete, the **embryo is born**—smallly, it grants longevity and joy; greatly, it transcends humanity to sainthood. Wandering in transformation, unbound in Heaven and Earth, when virtue is complete, one ascends to the **Jade Emptiness Above**. Such alchemy is profound and wondrous—how can cultivators of the **Elixir** not devote themselves to the **Dao**?

**Chapter Two**

**Huíyáng Zǐ** says: The **Dao** and **Nature** are one continuous principle. Heaven, possessing **qi**, covers all below; Earth, possessing **substance**, supports all above. Between them lies **eighty-four thousand li**. **Qi** and **substance** cannot naturally intermingle—Heaven, through **Kàn**, reaches into **Kùn**, returning to Earth, its **yang** bearing **yīn** upward; Earth, through **Kùn**, reaches into **Kàn**, returning to Heaven, its **yīn** embracing **yang** downward. In this endless rise and fall, they never stray from the **Dao**, thus enduring forever. There is no other reason.

Moreover, the **Nature of Heaven and Earth** is humanity’s most noble inheritance.

**Chapter Two (continued)**

The **Heart** compares to Heaven and bears the name **Vermilion Bird**, manifesting in the eyes as **red veins**; the **Kidneys** compare to Earth and bear the name **Dark Warrior**, affecting the eyes with **essence-qi**. The **Liver**, as the **yang** position, is likened to the **Green Dragon**, its essence appearing green in the eyes; the **Lungs**, as the **yin** position, are likened to the **White Tiger**, their essence appearing white when seen.

Heaven and Earth’s transformative forces converge entirely in the eyes. If one harmonizes them with clarity, the source of transformation is revealed—probing the **Kàn-Lì** phases, aligning with the dynamic rhythms of **symbols and correspondences**, day and night. With focused spirit and forgotten schemes, preserving light and embracing brightness, how could one fail to unite in **virtue** with Heaven and Earth?

Yet, from the moment humans separate from their parents, they are stained by the **six dusts**, their **Heavenly Five Qi** scattered and stripped away, their senses—eyes, ears, nose, tongue—entangled by sounds and colors. Thoughts stray from their proper place; external openness leads to inner dimness. When obstructed by the **Yellow Center**, the body fractures, its completeness lost to a single crooked path. Turning away from the root to chase the superficial, they forget to return, and the **Dao-heart** is veiled, hidden and unseen!

How could they then unite in **virtue** with Heaven and Earth? Not only do they fail to unite, but they further corrupt it with change—until the **Original Yang** is depleted, the **True Qi** lost, all because external things blind the eyes, and **essence** floats above **nature**, daily expending its light outward.

Alas! Why do those who study the **Dao** not awaken the depths of the *Yì* and reflect upon this?

Moreover, when **Kùn’s** proper position enters **Kàn’s** proper position, adding two strokes within, it becomes **Kàn**—for **Kàn-water** is internally luminous. If one penetrates the luminous nature of water, clarity flows unimpeded; if one clings to the luminous nature of fire, darkness multiplies. For above and below are both **yang** strokes, only red remains—yet when **Yellow** resides centrally, light emerges. Thus, **Lì-fire** is red from beginning to end, but excessive redness turns black.

What reliance can one place in this within humanity?

「Thus, those who cling to the external luminosity—this is the principle of the *Yì*’s light illuminating the Western River. Those who do not return to its source—this is the meaning of the separation between gold and wood.

Only the enlightened ones, when encountering each and every realm, follow their perception and restore it, thereby seizing its luminosity and returning to its essence, thus preserving the **virtue/power** of **Kùn**. When one preserves their **virtue/power**, their **nature** does not stray; when **nature** does not stray, the **spirit** does not wander; when the **spirit** does not wander, the **essence** does not disperse; when the **essence** does not disperse, the **True Qi** gathers. When **True Qi** gathers, the **essence** and **Lì-fire** follow in tandem; when **essence** and **Lì-fire** follow in tandem, the myriad **spirits** align with the **Primordial Origin**. The three flowers converge at the crown, maintaining the **Great Harmony**, and one attains immediate transcendence, achieving the radiance of the **Nine Tripod Elixir**, piercing the **Void Realm**, and aligning with the **Pure and Clear** in its transformation. Only then does one reside before the **Great Primordial Chaos** of **Tàichū**.

If not so, even at the moment of blinking, distinctions between self and others arise!

**Huíyáng Zǐ** said: The **Dao**’s natural course completes the twelve **Earthly Branches** and **Celestial Stems**, totaling ninety-six **kè** (moments). It encompasses all of heaven and earth, yet penetrates the finest hairs of autumn. The common folk, unaware, mistakenly insert four **kè** into the **Zǐ-wu-xǐ-yǒu** (Child-Midday-Mao-Western) cycle—this is all incorrect. Heaven and earth’s creation cannot be increased or diminished; to increase is to prolong, to diminish is to shorten. Heaven has ten **gān** (Celestial Stems), which are **yang** numbers, the root; earth has twelve **zhī** (Earthly Branches), which are **coupled** numbers, the end. The common folk follow the **Branches**, while sages follow the **Stems**; the remaining **kè** lie within them!

**Lǎozǐ** said: *"When the root descends and the end flows, the myriad things are born."* The root delves into the foundation and secures the origin; the end blooms and bears fruit. When the melon ripens, the stem detaches—its fragrance arises naturally. Only those who split the melon truly know its flavor.

To know: those who study the **Dao** must cultivate **spirit** and **Qi** fully. It is unnecessary to be bound by years, months, days, or **shí-chén** (times). This is the principle of *"form and spirit both attain perfection, merging with the **Dao** in truth."* Further, to delve into **nature**’s ultimate essence and ascend a step higher, one must attain **nature** and **life** as an indivisible whole, unrestricted in coming and going.

After achieving **True Stillness**, a point of luminous **spirit** pierces the **Jade Pool**—this is the **Mysterious Feminine**. Before heaven and earth were differentiated, they were like a chicken egg, hence the **Primordial Origin** is contained within the **Great Primordial Origin**. Before **Huntingian Chaos** was resolved, heaven and earth first divided: the **Primordial** is the substance, the **Post-Primordial** is the function. The light and clear ascend as heaven, the heavy and turbid descend as earth; the center is the human body—this is the **Three Talents**, the fixed source of all things.

Internally, the **Mysterious Feminine** is the root of heaven and earth; externally, it is the gateway of birth and death. Piercing the **Great Primordial Chaos**’s aperture, surging through the **Upper Vertex Pass**, boundless **immortals** emerge from here, and the myriad ages rank among the **Celestial Assembly**.

The teacher **Xiè** reveals the root and source: one escapes the cycle of **rebirth** and **samsara** externally, dwelling in mountains or cities with ease, hidden or revealed without obstruction in coming and going.

**Huíyáng Zǐ** said: *"From having arises non-having; from non-having arises having; from non-having emerges having; from having emerges non-having."* Thus, the *Xiāozāi Jīng* (Scripture of Eliminating Calamities) states: *"Having having and non-having having, the end is ever dark and unclear, unable to self-illuminate."* Yet those who illuminate the mind and perceive **nature** differ from this—when non-having is non-having and having is having, it diverges from this.

Therefore, **Zǐyáng Zhēnrén** (the **Purple Yang Sage**) said: *"**True Stillness** floats and sinks, distinguishing guest and host."* The root is **nature** as host, and first, **life** is established. The verse says: *"Though he be the guest, I am the host."* This is precisely the **floating and sinking of nature and life**.

For instance, the sun rises from the **Eastern Sea**, its auspicious **Qi** filling the sky, its rosy radiance dazzling. A hundred paces from the sea gate, its light begins to fade. As it nears its setting in the west, its radiance is reclaimed, returning to its origin—so too is this.

Those who study the **Dao** must understand this principle: scattering the **spirit**’s light, one pursues the myriad things. The common folk’s actions are thus, while sages follow perception and restore it, like the sun returning to its origin.

**Cuī Gōng**’s entry into the **Medicine Mirror** is this very principle! Hence it is said: *"The creation of heaven and earth is all gathered in the sun and moon; the creation of humanity is all gathered in the **Primordial Origin**."* Is this not the boundless transformation, enduring as long as heaven and earth?

**Huíyáng Zǐ** said: The **sage’s embryo** matures in ten months, and the infant manifests. Those who study the **Dao** are like a person building a house: first, one must lay the foundation solidly before it can bear weight. Awaiting the birth of **heaven and earth’s single yang**, one takes the month from the year, the day from the month, the **shí-chén** from the day, and the **kè** from the **shí-chén**. When ten months complete the embryo’s circle, the work is fulfilled, and **virtue/power** is attained—just as the common folk, after a thousand days, finally separate from their mother’s milk, gaining autonomy. When **yin** and **yang** meet, the self’s body arises from their union—not sought externally. *"Coming, clouds fill the thousand mountains; departing, the moon spans the ten thousand waters."*

Those who study the **Dao** possess their own **sage father** and **sage mother**, their own **self-born father and mother**. I awaken to seven parts, the teacher refines three parts; I awaken to three parts, the teacher refines seven parts—totaling ten parts. One must awaken and perceive themselves to enter the **Dao**. According to one’s capacity, one accommodates others and bears fruit; the **wooden method** lies entirely in **cultivating the soil**.

I see the world’s people, ever turning in confusion, failing to comprehend the sages’ classics. Once the human body is lost, they face countless kalpas to regain it. Is this not painful?

The **sea of suffering** is boundless—turning back is the path to liberation. It is not my intention now to speak bitterly in vain; I fear only that you may waste precious time. Instead, take it upon yourself to instantly awaken, transcend the mundane, and attain sainthood.

**Zǐyáng Zhēnrén** said: *"When a nation is wealthy and its people at peace, it seeks war; only after war does it see true tranquility."* A wealthy nation brings peace to its people; peaceful people enrich their nation. So too, when a person’s **Primordial Spirit**, **Primordial Darkness**, and **Primordial Essence** return to their proper abodes—the **spirit** to the **spirit chamber**, the **essence** to the **essence palace**, and the **Qi** to its **root**—if these three can return to their origins, then the nation is wealthy and its people at peace.

Further, if one penetrates this profound principle, it becomes the **Three Families Meeting** to form the **embryo of the sage**’s union. When two things meet, their **emotions** and **nature** merge. The **Tiger** and **Dragon** coil together at the center—this is the **soil**. **Wù** is **yang soil**, capable of generating the myriad things; **Jǐ** is **yin soil**, capable of nourishing the myriad things. Thus, the myriad things are born and grow—humanity is likewise.»

The **Venerable Purple Yang** says: *"To long endure the blade and the cup of the sage, as winter snows gather and congeal—this is the very way.*

The laughing infant and the rosy maiden, the Yellow Mother guiding the Master Dīng,
pointing the path across the **Cao Stream**,
ascending the **Kunlun Peak**—
the surging waves descend into the **Yellow Court**,
where **water** and **fire** meet in welcome.

**Master Huiyang** says: *"In this world, the **Spirit** is limited, but the body remains in excess.
Wealth, honor, and glory pass like fleeting blossoms—why weary the mind in pursuit?*

I urge those who cultivate the **Dao** to awaken soon to this truth:
from ancient times, all **Immortal Adepts** entered through this path.
The verse says:
*'Nine ten-thousand branches green and red,
Yet in seasons one sees their roots and shoots—
Do not say this fruit hard to ripen,
For it is watered by a single ladle from the **Sacred Source**.'*

And another verse says:
*'Treading all this world’s farthest shores,
Where does the Yellow Mother dwell?
The Master suddenly reveals the path—
I chop my feet to reach the **Misty Peaks**.'*

**Fourth,** **Master Huiyang** says: *"The **Heaven** has four seasons, the Sun twelve hours—
each hour holds its own profound use.
Those who refine must know the **Spirit’s** hiding and its movements,
past and future, to seize the moment.
Its deepest mystery lies in piercing the years,
clustered months, months clustered with days,
days clustered with hours, hours clustered with moments—
lest even a hair’s breadth be lost.

But the method does not end there.
One must ascend to align with the **celestial movements** of stars and constellations,
descend to harmonize with the **ebb and flow** of ocean tides,
harvest the **Qi** before **Heaven** and **Earth** divide,
and steal the **Essence** where **Sun** and **Moon** converge.
Thus the sage says: *'When Heaven and Earth exchange their times, they also exchange their **Qi**—
Just strike the door at the **Jia-Yi** moment.'*

For within each moment’s labor lies a day’s **Qi** and **timing**,
within each day’s labor lies a year’s **Qi** and **timing**.
One who grasps a year’s labor
can seize the **Heaven’s** and **Earth’s** **three thousand six hundred years** of measure.
How can the **unawakened** presume to fathom this?
Thus the verse says:*

The *Fu* hexagram’s first line moves—
Heaven’s heart shifts not.
Within this grasp of meaning,
The elixir’s foundation is laid.

**Fifth Section:** Master Yangzi said:
The ancient sages transmitted the Great Elixir’s gold,
Yet withheld the fire’s timing—
Not to reveal Heaven’s secrets.

Now I reveal its hidden intent,
This passage as its seal.

Fire’s efficacy lies only in this:
Dispersed, it becomes *qi*;
Concentrated, it becomes fire;
Transformed, it becomes water;
Altered, it becomes gold.

Condense this *qi*—
True essence unscattered—
And the fire’s timing lies within!

Thus it is said:
Fire has its timing, yet needs no hour—
A whisper of mechanism I alone know.
When the *qi* first returns at the new moon’s start,
Adjusting advance and retreat—
Let no delay linger.

Someone asks: How gather the herbs?
How refine the fire’s alchemy?
I reply:
Herbs bear the Mysterious Opening’s life,
Fire ignites the Yang Furnace’s glow.
Adjusting advance and retreat—
All depends on me.
When the *qi* first returns, the Transformation’s pivot is set.

**Sixth Section:** Master Yangzi said:
The Divine Furnace, the Elixir Cavern,
The Jade Chamber, the Golden Room—
These are but names for the alchemical vessel.

The Yellow Court, the Yellow Dao,
The Yellow Chamber, the Yellow Matron,
The Wu-Ji Bright Hall—
These are but names for the Central Palace.

True Yang is *Qian*—Heaven, Father, Husband.
The Yang Soul is the Azure Dragon,
The Lord of Wood, the Mercury of the Male.
Yang within Yin, the Sulfur within the Mercury,
The Cinnabar Father’s essence, the Wooden Fluid—
These are but names for the Infant Brother.

True Yin is *Kun*—Earth, Mother, Wife.
The Yin Spirit is the White Tiger,
The Female Lead, the Silver within the Lead.
Yin within Yang, the Mother’s Blood, the Golden Essence—
These are but names for the Astonished Maiden.

Though names abound, their principle is one.

Lead, neither too distant nor too near,
Must meet the Yang Mercury’s aid.
When it encounters True Earth, it becomes
The Great Elixir’s gold.

Master Ziyang said:
First, take *Qian* and *Kun* as the vessel,
Then drive the Black Hare’s elixir to boil.
Once the Two Creatures return to the Yellow Dao,
How could the Soul Elixir fail to manifest?
This is but one path of the Dao.

The common man scatters one into myriad,
Yet the sage gathers myriad into one—
Thus it is said: *My Dao is one, through which all is threaded.*

Descend to the One—
And the One gives birth to water,
My body’s North Dipper.

The Dipper arises from the One,
The One is the root of life—
My inherent nature,
The meaning of the Three-One Command.

The world’s utmost precision
Thus becomes spirit.
Spirit reaches its peak—
Yet spirit’s virtue never leaves the One.

Zhuangzi said:
*He who does not depart from precision is called the Spiritual Man.*

The One is the root of Heaven, Earth, and all things.
With root, life emerges;
With life, flourishing follows.
If the root is not deepened,
The stem not secured—
How then grasp *Hugging the One*?

From rising to repose, I think of the One.
In eating and drinking, I think of the One.
Never let the thought cease—
For the Great Mysterious One is the Northern Heaven’s *Qi*,
The *Qi* of the *Kan* Palace’s Rectification,
The Dao’s origin.

The One—
The Original One, the Great One,
The Mysterious One, the Founding One—
This *Qi* governs Heaven and Earth’s essence,
Crowns the primacy of Yin and Yang,
Is the root of the Two Luminaries,
The ancestor of all things.

It accumulates the chaos of Yin and Yang,
Its *qi* and essence turning from the *Kan* Palace to the *Dui* direction,
Called the Yang within Yin.

Without Yang in water,
How could it bear all things?

The True Seeker—
If he knows this Mysterious Heaven’s *Qi*
And begins his work from here,
Swiftly he will verify truth and attain the Way.

Now let us examine the North Dipper’s seven stars:
Stars are born from the Sun.
The Dipper arises from *Kan*,
Inheriting the Sun’s essence.

The Sun’s essence, born from the One,
*Kan* as a hexagram—
The Sun and Moon dwell within it!

Though *Li* is the Sun,
And *Kan* the Moon,
This is their division:
*Li* contains five numbers,
*Kan* contains five numbers—
Together, *Kan* and *Li* make ten.

Heaven One, Earth Six,
And *Kan* holds them both—
Thus it encompasses the Sun and Moon’s functions.

Men say the Dipper is northern,
But no—it is born from *Kan*,
Thus called the North Dipper.
It moves through the center,
Thus called the Central Dipper.

The song says:
*The Nine Elements reside in *Kan* at the Pole’s center,
All luminaries guard and transform.
The True Person freely returns to the Dipper’s handle,
Its shadow follows the Moon’s monthly course.*

*Kan* is truly the root of life,
*Li* the void of nature.

As the *Taishang* says in the *True Scriptures of the South and North Dippers*,
It first speaks of the North, then the South.

North is Heaven One,
South is Earth Two.
*Kan* is the Mysterious,
*Li* is the Vermilion.
Vermilion is fire,
Mysterious is water—
Water births fire,
Precision births *qi*.
To speak of the North without the South is impossible.
North and South unite,
*Kan* and *Li* intertwine—
Preserve the essence to enter spirit,
The marvel of their mutual use.

Without spirit and essence,
How could this be life’s command?

Life’s command within life—
Before parents conceived the embryo,
There was no root of life.

Life’s command within life—
Life lies in the Mysterious Origin,
The Mysterious Origin being the Dao’s *qi*.

Within the Mysterious, there is Mysterious—
This is my life.
Within life, there is life—
This is my form.

When essence, *qi*, and spirit are whole,
The body does not decay,
Form and life endure eternally,
In harmony with nature,
As long as Heaven and Earth.

Man’s birth—
Life is his root.
If life does not descend from Heaven,
The Dao cannot give birth.

Its day is natural,
Fixed by nature itself—
Like the command descending, received below.

For when the *qi* of the Nine Heavens descends,
Only then does the embryo form.
If the Nine Heaven’s Marshal does not issue the decree,
Man cannot be born.

Preserve the form, guard the spirit,
Cherish the *qi*, secure the root—
Thus death and decay are never known,
And the immortal’s way is attained.

The precious indeed!

The Classics say:
*"I do not see nor hear—
I do not know of the spirit,
Nor does the spirit depart from me,
Thus enduring with the Dao as long as ages."*

Then it speaks of *"my life is within me,
Not confined by Creation and Transformation."*[*]

The *Sutras of the Seven Primordials* say:
*"The Great Sovereign instructed the Seven Primordials:
'The Lower Primordial generates man,
From the *qi* of the *Yīnyūn* Primordial Unity,
The essence of the Primordial forming,
Endowed with life, one form complete.

The Three Primordials nurture,
The Nine *Qi* cover and protect.
Thus, the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper—
Every man possesses them fully.

The first nine stars, the *Potent Dragon* hidden,
Establish the *zi* position—
The Primordial Marshal of the Northern Dipper resides there!

Knowing this Primordial Spirit,
Cultivating its refinement and nourishment,
When form and spirit merge in unity,
The true essence manifests externally,
And the Mysterious Function is fulfilled.'*

The song declares:
*"Without stars, none bow to Heaven’s Enclosure—
Only the true mechanism lies in the dim and distant."*

Thus, the *Chénjī* (Polaris) is the *heart of Heaven*,
With rectitude as its square—
Facing the peak of *Kūnlún*,
Located in the *Purple Palace* of the Northern Pole, *Zhàngdōng*.

At the center of Heaven,
Within the Four Auxiliaries,
Beneath the *Huágài* (Celestial Canopy),
It is the *heart of Heaven*.

Still and unchanging—
It is the Master of the Primordial *Qi*,
The pivot and axis of Heaven and Earth."

The song declares:
*"The true Yang encloses the *qi* in ceaseless motion,
Ascending and descending through the Three Palaces in secret,
Life and death do not concern the floating world’s affairs—
Together they lead the Five Elders to the Golden Platform."*

The Five Elders are the spirits of the Five *Zàng* (Viscera),
Each man has them naturally—
The twelve nodes, the thirty-six minute bones,
Each pore aligned, each pulse connected,
Each node linked.

When cultivation reaches its peak,
Then *golden sinews and jade bones*,
The hundred limbs uncorrupted,
The pure *qi* ascends to become Heaven—
Pure yet purer, spirit yet more spirit,
Yang yet more Yang.

Man receives the Primordial *Qi* of Heaven and is born,
From the Three Pure Ones dividing their Three *Qi* into the Three Primordials—
The Upper *Dān Tiān* (Elixir Field) *Ní Wán Fǔ* (Mud Pellet Palace),
Ascending to correspond with the *Jade Purity* Green *Qi*;
The Middle *Dān Tiān* *Jiàng Gōng Fǔ* (Vermilion Palace),
Ascending to correspond with the *Upper Purity* White *Qi*;
The Lower *Dān Tiān* *Jiāo Huì Fǔ* (Convergence Palace),
Ascending to correspond with the *Supreme Purity* Yellow *Qi*.

This is what was spoken of earlier—
*"Preserving essence to enter the spirit."*

The *Supreme Purity* true soil,
Not the thick, heavy, and turbid earth of the world—
The transforming origin of all things.

Heaven unifies the Three Palaces as one,
Enduring through ten thousand ages without flaw.
The Three Palaces ascend and descend,
Ascending and descending without end—
This is what is meant!

To know one’s own Three Pure Ones—
Why seek above?
To know one’s own *Lǎo Jūn*—
Why search externally?

The *Supreme Sage* says:
*"Essence is my spirit,
*Qi* is my Dao.
Preserve essence and nurture *qi*,
Guard and uphold firm rectitude.

When Yin and Yang unite,
The true form is established—
And the transformation generates the Boy Child.
Test the breath at the nostrils—
It does not reach the ears.
Speak with the mouth—
It does not shake the lungs.
Then the elixir vein forms itself."*

*Qi* transforms into essence,
Essence transforms into spirit,
Spirit transforms into the Boy Child of the Heart.

Within my body reside the thirty-six thousand spirits,
Ever attending at my side.

If this is maintained over time,
Then one’s own Three Pure Ones, one’s own *Lǎo Jūn*, will appear!

Great are the mysteries of the Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars!
The Seven Stars’ true names and forms—
They are the Seven *Qi* of the Primordial Beginning,
Also the true *Qi* of the seven orifices within the human body.

The Yin-Yang Dipper Stars traverse the twelve *Zhī* (Earthly Branches) above,
The *zi-wǔ-ào-mǎo* (Child-Midday-Male Ox-Western Maid) palaces—
Within them lies the path to transcend the mundane and enter the sacred!

Thus, the fourth star *Wén Qū* (Literature Weaver),
Is the gate of Yin-Yang convergence—
The *zi-wǔ-ào-mǎo* positions where man is born.
The *ào-mǎo* (Male Ox-Western Maid) convergence occurs here,
And moreover, within Yin there is Yang,
Within Yang there is Yin—
This is called the *Two-Eight* Gate.

The *Dān* (Alchemy) Classics say:
*"The Dragon moves through the sixteen gates,
The Tiger hides in the nine and three doors—
Within the Heavenly Pass,
Its path is the Mysterious Extremity."*

Man can understand the mutual use of Yin and Yang,
The interplay of *Wū-Tù* (Heavenly Hare),
Thus the Dao’s *Qi* increases,
And the elixir spirit is accomplished.

The *Huáng Tíng* (Yellow Court) Classics say:
*"Within the Three Passes, essence, *Qi*, and spirit reside,
Within the Nine Profound, profound yet more profound.
The mouth is the Heavenly Pass—spirit’s mechanism,
The hands are the Human Pass—holding the flourishing and decline,
The feet are the Earthly Pass—life’s threshold.
And within the Dipper, the Three Passes are possessed—
The Heavenly Pass is at *wǔ*,
The Human Pass is at *ào-mǎo*,
The Earthly Pass is at *zi-wǔ*.
The Yin-Yang boundary positions,
The *ào-mǎo* doors where sun and moon enter and exit."*

Reflect now!
The Mysterious is the origin of all things,
Its principle inherent.

The hidden Mysterious of things,
Not as hidden as the Mysterious within the human body—
The Mysterious within the human body,
Is the Heavenly Mechanism,
The Mysterious Function.

Thus the *Yīn Fú* (Dark Seal) Classics say:
*"The sacred function is born from it,
The spirit and light emerge from it!"*

It is known:
The Mysterious is the origin of *Qi*,
The true of the Dao,
Heaven’s hue,
The marvel of the Law,
The profundity of principle,
Water’s source.

If one exhausts its principle,
Must construct its Mysterious,
Fulfill its nature,
Then reaching to its life.

Consider the beginning when *Hún Dùn* (Chaos) was undivided—
Where were the years, months, days, and hours?

Spirit is nature, *Qi* is life—
Spirit does not stray externally, *Qi* regulates itself.

The work is complete!
The seventh.

Huì-Yáng Zǐ said:
The Golden Elixir’s great medicine,
Indeed lies in what the Master transmits,
Yet also in Heaven’s favor.

Our Daoist Ancestor, the Most High Laozi,
In the *Dàodé Jīng* says:
*"Heaven’s Way has no favorites,
It always aids the virtuous."*

Our Ancestor, Master Wèi Bóyáng,
In the *Cāntóng Qì* says:
*"Heaven’s Way has no fixed path,
It is transmitted only to the worthy."*

Our Ancestor, Pure Yang True Person,
In the *Qìn Yuán Chūn* says:
*"The path of the humble gourd,
With three thousand deeds fulfilled,
Alone strides back to the clouds."*

Our Ancestor, Master Zhāng,
In his poem says:
*"The Great Medicine’s cultivation has ease and difficulty,
I know it depends on me and on Heaven—
If not for accumulated merit and hidden virtue,
Every move invites demons to obstruct."*

Again, in the *Xī Jiāng Yuè*:
*"If virtue surpasses eight hundred,
And hidden deeds reach three thousand,
Balancing all beings, kin, and grudges,
Only then does one fulfill the true wish of the Immortals."*

Indeed, the completion of the Golden Elixir
Is Heaven’s reward for the greatly virtuous.
If one does not cultivate hidden virtue
But merely seeks to steal the Great Dao,
Then Heaven will not aid them.
Even if they begin the practice,
Demons will soon arise to obstruct,
Or for years they toil in vain,
Only to blame the Dao or the Master,
And thus bring ruin upon themselves.

But if there are those who truly seek the Dao,
Ever mindful, compassionate, and aiding beings,
Rescuing the poor, relieving suffering,
Cherishing life, saving all sentient beings,
Encouraging loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and righteousness,
And performing all manner of hidden virtues—
Such as truly sparing life,
Or practicing skillful means to abstain from killing—
Then the Immortals will recommend them,
The Celestial Sovereign will bestow blessings.
They will swiftly find a clear Master,
Receive true transmission,
Begin cultivation with swift results,
Heaven aiding them, all spirits protecting,
No demonic obstructions, every action aligning with the True Principle.
In due time, the work will be complete,
Living in the world, eternally transcendent,
Ascending to the clouds,
Form and spirit both perfected,
Free and unbound.
Moreover, their blessings extend to descendants,
Enduring under the Dao’s shelter—
This, though the Master’s grace,
Is truly Heaven’s gift.

Twenty years of seeking the Dao,
Traversing ten thousand rivers and mountains,
No clear Master found—how could one rest?
How many times did I raise a single incense stick in prayer?

Fortunate to meet the Perfect One,
Who revealed the wondrous use of the Void,
The work accomplished in an instant,
Divine light radiant throughout the body.

---
*Xī Jiāng Yuè*
From death’s embrace, reborn again,
Returning to recognize the true self—
This journey’s boat, though bound for the coffin,
No eight winds can shake it.

A midnight moon wheel,
The Supreme Ultimate Diagram,
Ten thousand *lǐ* of clear azure,
Green peaks dissolving into clouds.

Joy supreme, joy supreme,
Common folk say it’s hard to find—
When asked what I do,
Silence is the Great Return.

---
*Jīn Dān Hé Cháo Hòu Tú*
*"Chisel open Chaos to reveal the Qiantang River,
The southern sky’s Yangtze as a silver screen—
Poets past and present have painted this scene,
Yet who can truly trace its origin?"*

Years pass, years return,
Days of *Gēng*, months of *Jiǎ*—
Why this sudden chaos?
Now it is revealed:
To know Heaven and Earth’s true source.

The Dao disperses, yet one name prevails—
The Five Phases in reverse,
Mutually arrayed in Heaven and Earth’s cycles.

The *Kǎn* Water flows backward toward the *Bǐng* Gate,
Following the waxing and waning of the moon,
Qi peaking at the Mid-Autumn Festival.

Gold can generate Water,
Doubly surging like a thousand layers of snow—
The Immortals’ wondrous use
Differs not from the tides.

This ode to the *Jiāngyuè* Moon,
Silently aligning with the Heavenly Cycle’s numbers,

**Preface to *Essentials of Longevity***

In my youth, I was afflicted by sorrow, my brush and ink neglected, and I grew weary of worldly tastes. Then, upon reading the *Scripture on Purity and Stillness (Qīngjìng Jīng)*, I awoke to self-examination. Thus, I abandoned my home with a resolute heart, clad in rags and barefoot, wandering and seeking across half the land. As for the practices of *visualizing the kidneys to nurture the heart* and *swallowing saliva to internalize qi*, I tried them all. Yet what lingered in my mind was the matter of *Golden Elixir (Jīndān)*, whose roots I had yet to fathom.

Then, fate unfolded—**Master Lǚ Zhēnrén of Western Shu** appeared before me at the **Yānxīá Dàoyuàn** in Chángtíng. With joy, he entrusted me with the secrets of elixir refinement: the methods of *fire regulation, adding and reducing*, all as clear as the palm of my hand. For years now, I have followed his teachings with reverence!

Seeing how common folk stray into convoluted side paths, ever farther from the Dao, I could not bear to keep these truths hidden. Thus, I expounded in subtle words, setting them down in seven chapters, naming this work *Essentials of Longevity (Chángshēng Zhǐyào)*. May those with sincere intent thereby attain enlightenment!

Written on the **Mid-Autumn Day of the Year *Chúnyóu Gēnxū*** (1250 CE),
By **Huíyáng Zǐ** Lin Zìrán

chunks.original_text: 窃闻先天大道，在混沌之中，不可以识识，不可以知知。 以耳听之而眼闻，以眼视之而耳见。 恍恍惚惚，杳杳冥冥，似物非物，似象非象，强名曰道。 夫道之妙，既不可得而测，则在於仰观俯察而已。 以人身参之，若合符节。 予既得玄中之玄，妙中之妙，不敢尽秘，特於有无中，发出根蒂。 牝者，即混沌未分之黑也，犹瓜之有蒂，中藏真精，神黑贯通，混合造化，岂非太乙含真之妙乎！ 两仪既判，始生四象，四象生矣，而五行备焉！ 然后分布八卦，惟中宫之位，实为八卦之母也。 中宫乃土之位也。 故水得土则止，火得土则息，金得土则生，木得土则旺，有如子在母胞之中，日得天地冲和之黑，正禀中宫，同母呼吸，以至胞圆既生之后，前去脐蒂，所受天地之正黑，熏蒸，与虚皇之神炁贯通，本与天地齐久，与虚皇共化。 一为情欲感於内外，好乐发於后先，自此炁隔真，元神随物诱，虽与天地之真炁交接，奈何神化无基，反为天地所夺，至使形衰炁谢，是以不免於死亡之患也。 信此炁者，乃元始浩劫之祖炁，神仙性命之宗源，得之则生，失之则死矣！ 得之者夺天地之造化，不得者反为天地之所夺，其所夺者，一点元阳之真炁也。 修炼之士，何不归明於本，依时锻炼，以为大丹。 且锻炼之法，不过母呼则呼，母吸则吸，一呼则天炁下降，一吸则地炁上升，呼吸有时，不比盲炼，动一神则万神俱动，开一窍则九窍皆开。 学道之士，当寻其源，如在母胞之中，抱其元，守其一，太一含真炁，天地长黄芽。 盖黄芽生，乃铅之母也，不能行者，以致炁绝命亡，皆不能回光返照，止察於外而不能自察也。 回阳子曰：天地之精英，皆聚於日月，人之精英，悉聚於眼目。 夫人成形之时，先生两肾，内应精轮，次生两目，有如水泡，与天地实同。 盖天地未分之时，日月未照之际，混混沌沌，幽幽冥冥。 二仪方分，两曜着明，水火始出，万物乃生，故有变化之妙。 人欲修炼，须当采元始炁於横目之下，以索天地之蕴，而致其用，可也。 若能致此妙用，谓之高奔日月！ 彻照昆仑。 前辈度人，皆不过指此为轨范也。 黄庭者，安炉立鼎之地也，圣功从此而生焉！ 神明从此而出焉！ 上清下浊，路通八水，上至泥丸，中理五炁，混合百神，下至涌泉，周而复始，昼夜不息，所得天地之正孟与神无精三者，可交结於此。 功满十月，即得胎圆出世，小而至於延年快乐，大而至於超凡入圣。 遨游变化，逍遥於天地之间，功满德就，即还於玉虚之上。 如斯之化，且玄且妙，修丹之士，可不栖心於道乎！ 第二 回阳子曰：道之与性，则一贯之理也。 天得之积炁，以覆於下，地得之，托质以载於上，覆载之问，其相去有八万四千里。 炁质本不能相交也，天以乾索於坤，即还於＇地中，其阳负阴而上升； 地以坤索於乾，即还於天中，其阴抱阳而下降，一升一降，运行无穷，不失於道，所以长久。 岂有他哉！ 且天地之性，於人为贵者也。

**Essentials of Longevity**
Narrated by **Huíyáng Zǐ** Lin Zìrán
**Chapter One**

I have heard that the **Primordial Dao** lies within the **Hun-tun**—unfathomable by perception, ungraspable by cognition. Listen with the ears and hear with the eyes; see with the eyes and perceive with the ears. Vague and indistinct, dim and obscure, neither form nor image, yet named as **Dao**. The subtlety of the Dao being beyond measure, one must only gaze upward and downward to comprehend it. When aligned with the human body, it fits like matching seals.

Having attained the **mystery within the mystery**, the **subtlety within the subtlety**, I dare not keep it entirely concealed. Thus, from the realm of **Being and Non-Being**, I reveal its roots. The **Receptive (Yīn)** is the undivided black of **Hun-tun**, like the stem of a gourd, containing the true essence. The **black qi** permeates, blending with **Creation**,—is this not the marvel of **Taiyi** embracing the true **qi**?

Once the **Two Principles (Yīn-Yáng)** are distinguished, the **Four Symbols** emerge, and from them, the **Five Phases** manifest. Then the **Eight Trigrams** are arranged, with the **central palace** as their origin. The central palace is the domain of **Earth**. Thus, water finds stability in Earth, fire finds rest, metal finds life, and wood flourishes—like a child in its mother’s womb, nourished by the **primordial black qi** of Heaven and Earth, aligned with the central palace, breathing in unison. Once the embryo forms and the umbilical cord is severed, the received **true black qi** of Heaven and Earth, infused with the **Divine Sovereign’s spirit-qi**, merges with the primordial harmony, enduring as long as Heaven and Earth, sharing in their transformation.

Yet when **emotions and desires** stir within and without, when **pleasures and attachments** arise, the **qi** separates from the true, the **original spirit** follows external allurements. Though it mingles with the **true qi** of Heaven and Earth, without a foundation for **transformation**, it is instead seized by them, causing the body to decay and the **qi** to fade—thus, death becomes inevitable.

This **qi** is the **Primordial Chaos’s ancestral breath**, the **source of immortal life and fate**. To possess it is to live; to lose it is to die. Those who attain it **plunder Heaven and Earth’s creation**; those who fail are **plundered by them**—what is lost is the **single point of original yang-qi**.

Practitioners of cultivation, why not return to the **Root** and refine according to the seasons, forging the **Great Elixir**? The method of refinement is simple: inhale when the **Mother** exhales, exhale when the **Mother** inhales. Each inhalation draws **Heaven’s qi** downward; each exhalation raises **Earth’s qi** upward. Breathing follows its natural rhythm, not blindly forced—stir one spirit, and all spirits move; open one orifice, and all orifices open.

Seekers of the Dao must trace its source, as if still within the **mother’s womb**, embracing the **Primordial**, guarding the **One**. **Taiyi** contains the true **qi**; Heaven and Earth nurture the **Yellow Sprout**. The **Yellow Sprout** is the **mother of Lead**—those who fail to cultivate see their **qi** severed, their life extinguished, unable to **reclaim the lost light** and reflect inward, fixated only on the external.

**Huíyáng Zǐ** says: The **essence of Heaven and Earth** gathers in the **sun and moon**; the **essence of humanity** resides in the **eyes**. When a person takes form, the **kidneys** emerge first, corresponding to the **Wheel of Essence** within. Then the **eyes** form, like water droplets, mirroring Heaven and Earth in their purity. Before Heaven and Earth divided, before the **Two Luminaires** shone, all was **Hun-tun**, dim and obscure. When the **Two Principles** separated, the **Two Luminaires** illuminated, **water and fire** emerged, and all things were born—thus arises the marvel of **transformation**.

To cultivate, one must extract the **Primordial qi** beneath the **horizontal eyes**, seeking the **Heavenly-Earthly essence** and applying it. If this subtlety is mastered, it is called **soaring beyond sun and moon**, piercing the **Kunlun peaks**. Ancestors of the Dao taught no other path.

The **Yellow Court** is the **furnace and cauldron** where sacred deeds are forged, where **divinity** is born. **Pure above, turbid below**, the path connects the **Eight Waters**, ascending to the **Sea of Marrow**, regulating the **Five Qi**, blending the **Hundred Spirits**, descending to the **Gushing Spring**, cycling endlessly day and night. The **true essence of Heaven and Earth**, along with the **spirit without form**, may be united here. When the **ten months** of cultivation are complete, the **embryo is born**—smallly, it grants longevity and joy; greatly, it transcends humanity to sainthood. Wandering in transformation, unbound in Heaven and Earth, when virtue is complete, one ascends to the **Jade Emptiness Above**. Such alchemy is profound and wondrous—how can cultivators of the **Elixir** not devote themselves to the **Dao**?

**Chapter Two**

**Huíyáng Zǐ** says: The **Dao** and **Nature** are one continuous principle. Heaven, possessing **qi**, covers all below; Earth, possessing **substance**, supports all above. Between them lies **eighty-four thousand li**. **Qi** and **substance** cannot naturally intermingle—Heaven, through **Kàn**, reaches into **Kùn**, returning to Earth, its **yang** bearing **yīn** upward; Earth, through **Kùn**, reaches into **Kàn**, returning to Heaven, its **yīn** embracing **yang** downward. In this endless rise and fall, they never stray from the **Dao**, thus enduring forever. There is no other reason.

Moreover, the **Nature of Heaven and Earth** is humanity’s most noble inheritance.

The **Heart** compares to Heaven and bears the name **Vermilion Bird**, manifesting in the eyes as **red veins**; the **Kidneys** compare to Earth and bear the name **Dark Warrior**, affecting the eyes with **essence-qi**. The **Liver**, as the **yang** position, is likened to the **Green Dragon**, its essence appearing green in the eyes; the **Lungs**, as the **yin** position, are likened to the **White Tiger**, their essence appearing white when seen.

Heaven and Earth’s transformative forces converge entirely in the eyes. If one harmonizes them with clarity, the source of transformation is revealed—probing the **Kàn-Lì** phases, aligning with the dynamic rhythms of **symbols and correspondences**, day and night. With focused spirit and forgotten schemes, preserving light and embracing brightness, how could one fail to unite in **virtue** with Heaven and Earth?

Yet, from the moment humans separate from their parents, they are stained by the **six dusts**, their **Heavenly Five Qi** scattered and stripped away, their senses—eyes, ears, nose, tongue—entangled by sounds and colors. Thoughts stray from their proper place; external openness leads to inner dimness. When obstructed by the **Yellow Center**, the body fractures, its completeness lost to a single crooked path. Turning away from the root to chase the superficial, they forget to return, and the **Dao-heart** is veiled, hidden and unseen!

How could they then unite in **virtue** with Heaven and Earth? Not only do they fail to unite, but they further corrupt it with change—until the **Original Yang** is depleted, the **True Qi** lost, all because external things blind the eyes, and **essence** floats above **nature**, daily expending its light outward.

Alas! Why do those who study the **Dao** not awaken the depths of the *Yì* and reflect upon this?

Moreover, when **Kùn’s** proper position enters **Kàn’s** proper position, adding two strokes within, it becomes **Kàn**—for **Kàn-water** is internally luminous. If one penetrates the luminous nature of water, clarity flows unimpeded; if one clings to the luminous nature of fire, darkness multiplies. 「Thus, those who cling to the external luminosity—this is the principle of the *Yì*’s light illuminating the Western River. Those who do not return to its source—this is the meaning of the separation between gold and wood.

Only the enlightened ones, when encountering each and every realm, follow their perception and restore it, thereby seizing its luminosity and returning to its essence, thus preserving the **virtue/power** of **Kùn**. When one preserves their **virtue/power**, their **nature** does not stray; when **nature** does not stray, the **spirit** does not wander; when the **spirit** does not wander, the **essence** does not disperse; when the **essence** does not disperse, the **True Qi** gathers. When **True Qi** gathers, the **essence** and **Lì-fire** follow in tandem; when **essence** and **Lì-fire** follow in tandem, the myriad **spirits** align with the **Primordial Origin**. The three flowers converge at the crown, maintaining the **Great Harmony**, and one attains immediate transcendence, achieving the radiance of the **Nine Tripod Elixir**, piercing the **Void Realm**, and aligning with the **Pure and Clear** in its transformation. Only then does one reside before the **Great Primordial Chaos** of **Tàichū**.

If not so, even at the moment of blinking, distinctions between self and others arise!

**Huíyáng Zǐ** said: The **Dao**’s natural course completes the twelve **Earthly Branches** and **Celestial Stems**, totaling ninety-six **kè** (moments). It encompasses all of heaven and earth, yet penetrates the finest hairs of autumn. The common folk, unaware, mistakenly insert four **kè** into the **Zǐ-wu-xǐ-yǒu** (Child-Midday-Mao-Western) cycle—this is all incorrect. Heaven and earth’s creation cannot be increased or diminished; to increase is to prolong, to diminish is to shorten. Heaven has ten **gān** (Celestial Stems), which are **yang** numbers, the root; earth has twelve **zhī** (Earthly Branches), which are **coupled** numbers, the end. The common folk follow the **Branches**, while sages follow the **Stems**; the remaining **kè** lie within them!

**Lǎozǐ** said: *"When the root descends and the end flows, the myriad things are born."* The root delves into the foundation and secures the origin; the end blooms and bears fruit. When the melon ripens, the stem detaches—its fragrance arises naturally. Only those who split the melon truly know its flavor.

To know: those who study the **Dao** must cultivate **spirit** and **Qi** fully. It is unnecessary to be bound by years, months, days, or **shí-chén** (times). This is the principle of *"form and spirit both attain perfection, merging with the **Dao** in truth."* Further, to delve into **nature**’s ultimate essence and ascend a step higher, one must attain **nature** and **life** as an indivisible whole, unrestricted in coming and going.

After achieving **True Stillness**, a point of luminous **spirit** pierces the **Jade Pool**—this is the **Mysterious Feminine**. Before heaven and earth were differentiated, they were like a chicken egg, hence the **Primordial Origin** is contained within the **Great Primordial Origin**. Before **Huntingian Chaos** was resolved, heaven and earth first divided: the **Primordial** is the substance, the **Post-Primordial** is the function. The light and clear ascend as heaven, the heavy and turbid descend as earth; the center is the human body—this is the **Three Talents**, the fixed source of all things.

Internally, the **Mysterious Feminine** is the root of heaven and earth; externally, it is the gateway of birth and death. Piercing the **Great Primordial Chaos**’s aperture, surging through the **Upper Vertex Pass**, boundless **immortals** emerge from here, and the myriad ages rank among the **Celestial Assembly**.

The teacher **Xiè** reveals the root and source: one escapes the cycle of **rebirth** and **samsara** externally, dwelling in mountains or cities with ease, hidden or revealed without obstruction in coming and going.

**Huíyáng Zǐ** said: *"From having arises non-having; from non-having arises having; from non-having emerges having; from having emerges non-having."* Thus, the *Xiāozāi Jīng* (Scripture of Eliminating Calamities) states: *"Having having and non-having having, the end is ever dark and unclear, unable to self-illuminate."* Yet those who illuminate the mind and perceive **nature** differ from this—when non-having is non-having and having is having, it diverges from this.

Therefore, **Zǐyáng Zhēnrén** (the **Purple Yang Sage**) said: *"**True Stillness** floats and sinks, distinguishing guest and host."* The root is **nature** as host, and first, **life** is established. The verse says: *"Though he be the guest, I am the host."* This is precisely the **floating and sinking of nature and life**.

For instance, the sun rises from the **Eastern Sea**, its auspicious **Qi** filling the sky, its rosy radiance dazzling. A hundred paces from the sea gate, its light begins to fade. As it nears its setting in the west, its radiance is reclaimed, returning to its origin—so too is this.

Those who study the **Dao** must understand this principle: scattering the **spirit**’s light, one pursues the myriad things. The common folk’s actions are thus, while sages follow perception and restore it, like the sun returning to its origin.

**Cuī Gōng**’s entry into the **Medicine Mirror** is this very principle! Hence it is said: *"The creation of heaven and earth is all gathered in the sun and moon; the creation of humanity is all gathered in the **Primordial Origin**."* Is this not the boundless transformation, enduring as long as heaven and earth?

**Huíyáng Zǐ** said: The **sage’s embryo** matures in ten months, and the infant manifests. Those who study the **Dao** are like a person building a house: first, one must lay the foundation solidly before it can bear weight. Awaiting the birth of **heaven and earth’s single yang**, one takes the month from the year, the day from the month, the **shí-chén** from the day, and the **kè** from the **shí-chén**. When ten months complete the embryo’s circle, the work is fulfilled, and **virtue/power** is attained—just as the common folk, after a thousand days, finally separate from their mother’s milk, gaining autonomy. When **yin** and **yang** meet, the self’s body arises from their union—not sought externally. *"Coming, clouds fill the thousand mountains; departing, the moon spans the ten thousand waters."*

Those who study the **Dao** possess their own **sage father** and **sage mother**, their own **self-born father and mother**. I awaken to seven parts, the teacher refines three parts; I awaken to three parts, the teacher refines seven parts—totaling ten parts. One must awaken and perceive themselves to enter the **Dao**. According to one’s capacity, one accommodates others and bears fruit; the **wooden method** lies entirely in **cultivating the soil**.

I see the world’s people, ever turning in confusion, failing to comprehend the sages’ classics. Once the human body is lost, they face countless kalpas to regain it. Is this not painful?

The **sea of suffering** is boundless—turning back is the path to liberation. It is not my intention now to speak bitterly in vain; I fear only that you may waste precious time. Instead, take it upon yourself to instantly awaken, transcend the mundane, and attain sainthood.

**Zǐyáng Zhēnrén** said: *"When a nation is wealthy and its people at peace, it seeks war; only after war does it see true tranquility."* A wealthy nation brings peace to its people; peaceful people enrich their nation. So too, when a person’s **Primordial Spirit**, **Primordial Darkness**, and **Primordial Essence** return to their proper abodes—the **spirit** to the **spirit chamber**, the **essence** to the **essence palace**, and the **Qi** to its **root**—if these three can return to their origins, then the nation is wealthy and its people at peace.

Further, if one penetrates this profound principle, it becomes the **Three Families Meeting** to form the **embryo of the sage**’s union. When two things meet, their **emotions** and **nature** merge. The **Tiger** and **Dragon** coil together at the center—this is the **soil**. **Wù** is **yang soil**, capable of generating the myriad things; **Jǐ** is **yin soil**, capable of nourishing the myriad things. Thus, the myriad things are born and grow—humanity is likewise.»

chunks.original_text: 复卦初爻动，天心无转移，个中得意处，便好作丹基。 第五 回阳子曰：上古圣人，传授金丹大药，独於火候不传者，不泄天机故也。 予今略露秘旨，以此篇为印证。 夫火之功验，不过散之则成炁，聚之则成火，化之则成水，变之则成金。 凝此一炁，真元不散，则火候在其中矣！ 故曰火虽有候，不须时，些子机关我自知，一炁初回才遇朔，抽添进退莫教迟者是也。 或问药物如何采？ 火候如何煎？ 答曰：药物生玄窍，火候发阳炉，抽添进退皆由我，一炁初回造化枢。 第六 回阳子曰：夫神炉丹穴，神室玉炉金房，此皆丹鼎之异名也。 黄庭黄道，黄房黄婆，戊己明堂，此皆中宫之异名也。 真阳为乾，为天为父，为夫。 阳魂青龙，郎君木汞，阳中阴，砂中汞，朱砂父精木液，此皆婴兄之异名也。 真阴为坤，为地为母，为妇，阴魄白虎，女子金铅，阴中阳，铅中银，水银母血金精，此皆诧女之异名也。 其名虽多，其理则一。 其为铅也，远不可取，近不可舍，得阳汞相济，遇真土方成，即金丹大药也。 紫阳真人云：先把乾坤为鼎器，后搏乌兔药来烹，既驱二物归黄道，争得灵丹不解生者，乃道中之一也。 凡夫无和，散一为万，惟圣人能会万归一，故曰吾道一以贯之。 夫降而为一，一乃生水，吾身中之北斗也。 斗自一生，一为命本，我之禀受，是为本命一三之义。 天下之至精，故能神，神则至矣！ 而神之为德，未尝离一。 庄子曰：不离於精，谓之神人。 一者天地万物之根，有根则能生，有生则可荣。 苟不深其根，固其蒂，将何以为抱一乎！ 予起处念一，卧寐念一，饮食念一，无不念一，无使间断，诚以太玄之一是北方玄天，坎宫正一之炁，大道之祖也。 一者，元一大一，玄一奠一，此一炁统天地之元，冠阴阳之首，为两曜之根本，是万物之祖宗。 其积混沌阴阳，精炁从坎官转归兑乡，号曰阴中之阳。 若水中无阳，安能载物？ 修真之士，傥知此玄天一炁而下手兴工，指日证真成道矣！ 今且即以北斗七星而备之，星者日之所生也，北斗从坎生，禀日之精也。 太阳之精，自从一生，坎之为卦，日月葆焉！ 虽曰离为日，坎为月，此卦之分，离函五数，坎函五数，兼坎离而成十也。 天一地六而坎又居之，是兼日月之用也。 人谓北斗以其在北，非也，生於坎故，曰北斗，运於中，故曰中斗。 歌曰：九元位坎居中极，众曜持守掌化成，真人自在归魁上，垂象杓从月建行。 夫坎实为命本，离虚为性本。 如太上说南北二斗真经，亦先北而后南。 北为天一，南为地二，坎为玄，离为赤。 赤，火也，玄，水也，水中生火，精中生炁，说北不可以无南，南北会合，坎离交并，存精以入神，互用之妙也。 若非精神，岂日本命！ 命中之命，在父母未生胞胎之前，无本之命也。 命中之命，命在玄元，玄元者，道之一炁也。 玄中有玄，是我命，命中有命是我形。 精炁神全，则身不衰老，形命永存，合乎自然，与天地相为长久。 人之生也，命以为本，命不禀於天，道不能生也。 其日自然，固有自然而然，犹上命而下受也。 盖九天之炁下降，方结胞胎，九天司马不下命章，人终不能生。 受形保神，贵炁固根，终不死坏，而得神仙。

The *Fu* hexagram’s first line moves—
Heaven’s heart shifts not.
Within this grasp of meaning,
The elixir’s foundation is laid.

**Fifth Section:** Master Yangzi said:
The ancient sages transmitted the Great Elixir’s gold,
Yet withheld the fire’s timing—
Not to reveal Heaven’s secrets.

Now I reveal its hidden intent,
This passage as its seal.

Fire’s efficacy lies only in this:
Dispersed, it becomes *qi*;
Concentrated, it becomes fire;
Transformed, it becomes water;
Altered, it becomes gold.

Condense this *qi*—
True essence unscattered—
And the fire’s timing lies within!

Thus it is said:
Fire has its timing, yet needs no hour—
A whisper of mechanism I alone know.
When the *qi* first returns at the new moon’s start,
Adjusting advance and retreat—
Let no delay linger.

Someone asks: How gather the herbs?
How refine the fire’s alchemy?
I reply:
Herbs bear the Mysterious Opening’s life,
Fire ignites the Yang Furnace’s glow.
Adjusting advance and retreat—
All depends on me.
When the *qi* first returns, the Transformation’s pivot is set.

**Sixth Section:** Master Yangzi said:
The Divine Furnace, the Elixir Cavern,
The Jade Chamber, the Golden Room—
These are but names for the alchemical vessel.

The Yellow Court, the Yellow Dao,
The Yellow Chamber, the Yellow Matron,
The Wu-Ji Bright Hall—
These are but names for the Central Palace.

True Yang is *Qian*—Heaven, Father, Husband.
The Yang Soul is the Azure Dragon,
The Lord of Wood, the Mercury of the Male.
Yang within Yin, the Sulfur within the Mercury,
The Cinnabar Father’s essence, the Wooden Fluid—
These are but names for the Infant Brother.

True Yin is *Kun*—Earth, Mother, Wife.
The Yin Spirit is the White Tiger,
The Female Lead, the Silver within the Lead.
Yin within Yang, the Mother’s Blood, the Golden Essence—
These are but names for the Astonished Maiden.

Though names abound, their principle is one.

Lead, neither too distant nor too near,
Must meet the Yang Mercury’s aid.
When it encounters True Earth, it becomes
The Great Elixir’s gold.

Master Ziyang said:
First, take *Qian* and *Kun* as the vessel,
Then drive the Black Hare’s elixir to boil.
Once the Two Creatures return to the Yellow Dao,
How could the Soul Elixir fail to manifest?
This is but one path of the Dao.

The common man scatters one into myriad,
Yet the sage gathers myriad into one—
Thus it is said: *My Dao is one, through which all is threaded.*

Descend to the One—
And the One gives birth to water,
My body’s North Dipper.

The Dipper arises from the One,
The One is the root of life—
My inherent nature,
The meaning of the Three-One Command.

The world’s utmost precision
Thus becomes spirit.
Spirit reaches its peak—
Yet spirit’s virtue never leaves the One.

Zhuangzi said:
*He who does not depart from precision is called the Spiritual Man.*

The One is the root of Heaven, Earth, and all things.
With root, life emerges;
With life, flourishing follows.
If the root is not deepened,
The stem not secured—
How then grasp *Hugging the One*?

From rising to repose, I think of the One.
In eating and drinking, I think of the One.
Never let the thought cease—
For the Great Mysterious One is the Northern Heaven’s *Qi*,
The *Qi* of the *Kan* Palace’s Rectification,
The Dao’s origin.

The One—
The Original One, the Great One,
The Mysterious One, the Founding One—
This *Qi* governs Heaven and Earth’s essence,
Crowns the primacy of Yin and Yang,
Is the root of the Two Luminaries,
The ancestor of all things.

It accumulates the chaos of Yin and Yang,
Its *qi* and essence turning from the *Kan* Palace to the *Dui* direction,
Called the Yang within Yin.

Without Yang in water,
How could it bear all things?

The True Seeker—
If he knows this Mysterious Heaven’s *Qi*
And begins his work from here,
Swiftly he will verify truth and attain the Way.

Now let us examine the North Dipper’s seven stars:
Stars are born from the Sun.
The Dipper arises from *Kan*,
Inheriting the Sun’s essence.

The Sun’s essence, born from the One,
*Kan* as a hexagram—
The Sun and Moon dwell within it!

Though *Li* is the Sun,
And *Kan* the Moon,
This is their division:
*Li* contains five numbers,
*Kan* contains five numbers—
Together, *Kan* and *Li* make ten.

Heaven One, Earth Six,
And *Kan* holds them both—
Thus it encompasses the Sun and Moon’s functions.

Men say the Dipper is northern,
But no—it is born from *Kan*,
Thus called the North Dipper.
It moves through the center,
Thus called the Central Dipper.

The song says:
*The Nine Elements reside in *Kan* at the Pole’s center,
All luminaries guard and transform.
The True Person freely returns to the Dipper’s handle,
Its shadow follows the Moon’s monthly course.*

*Kan* is truly the root of life,
*Li* the void of nature.

As the *Taishang* says in the *True Scriptures of the South and North Dippers*,
It first speaks of the North, then the South.

North is Heaven One,
South is Earth Two.
*Kan* is the Mysterious,
*Li* is the Vermilion.
Vermilion is fire,
Mysterious is water—
Water births fire,
Precision births *qi*.
To speak of the North without the South is impossible.
North and South unite,
*Kan* and *Li* intertwine—
Preserve the essence to enter spirit,
The marvel of their mutual use.

Without spirit and essence,
How could this be life’s command?

Life’s command within life—
Before parents conceived the embryo,
There was no root of life.

Life’s command within life—
Life lies in the Mysterious Origin,
The Mysterious Origin being the Dao’s *qi*.

Within the Mysterious, there is Mysterious—
This is my life.
Within life, there is life—
This is my form.

When essence, *qi*, and spirit are whole,
The body does not decay,
Form and life endure eternally,
In harmony with nature,
As long as Heaven and Earth.

Man’s birth—
Life is his root.
If life does not descend from Heaven,
The Dao cannot give birth.

Its day is natural,
Fixed by nature itself—
Like the command descending, received below.

For when the *qi* of the Nine Heavens descends,
Only then does the embryo form.
If the Nine Heaven’s Marshal does not issue the decree,
Man cannot be born.

Preserve the form, guard the spirit,
Cherish the *qi*, secure the root—
Thus death and decay are never known,
And the immortal’s way is attained.

chunks.original_text: 贵乎哉！ 经云：我不视不听，不知神，不出神，与道同久。 然后言我命在我，不囿於造化。 《七元经》云：大帝告七真曰：下元生人，从氤氲真一之炁，元精所生，禀为一形皆备。 三元养育，九气覆护。 故北斗七元，人人具足。 初九潜龙，建子之位也，北斗元君在焉！ 知此元神，运毓涵养，形神合同，则真灵外应，玄功自成。 歌曰：无星不拱天垣北，惟有真机在杳冥。 故辰极者，为天心，以正为方，对昆仑之顶，在紫官北极崆峒。 正天之中，四辅之内，华盖之下，为天之心。 静而不动为元炁之主，符天地之枢纪也。 歌曰：真阳馆裹炁徘徊，升降三宫密往来，生死不关浮世事，相将五老上金台。 五老者，五藏之神也，人人自有，一十二节，三十六小骨，孔孔相对，脉脉相通，节节相连。 修炼功至，则金筋玉骨，百骸不坏，清炁上升而为天，清之又清，神之又神，阳之又阳。 人禀天元一炁而生，自三清分三炁於三元，上丹田泥丸府，上应玉清青炁； 中丹田绛宫府，上应上清白炁； 下丹田交会府，上应太清黄炁。 前所谓存精以入神是也。 太清真土，非厚地重浊之土，化生万物者。 天也，统三宫以为一，亘万世而无弊。 三宫升降，上下往来，无穷不息，斯之谓欤！ 要知自己三清，何劳上望？ 自己老君，何假外觅？ 太上曰：精是吾神，炁是吾道，藏精养炁，保守坚正。 阴阳交合，以立真形，而化生童子，尝审鼻息，不至耳闻，口言不至肺震，则丹脉自成。 炁化为精，精化为神，神化乃心之童子也。 我身中有三万六千神君，常侍左右。 久久如此，则自己三清、自己老君见矣！ 大哉！ 北斗七星之妙用乎！ 七星真形名号，乃元始七真之七炁，亦人身中七窍之真炁。 阴阳斗星，巡历十二支之上，子午卯酉之宫，有超凡入圣之道在其中矣！ 故第四文曲，乃阴阳交会之门，正卯酉生人所属，卯酉会合于此，况阴中有阳，阳中有阴，是曰二八之门。 丹经云：龙游十六之门，虎隐九三之户，在乎天关，其道乃玄极。 人能明阴阳互用，乌兔交加，道炁由是增，神丹乃克就。 《黄庭经》云：三关之中精炁神，九微之内幽且幽。 口为天关精神机，手为人关把盛衰，足为地关生命扉。 而斗中具有三关，天关在午，人关在卯酉，地关在子午。 阴阳隔界之位，卯酉日月出入之门。 磋夫！ 玄者万物之祖，理具有也。 物之隐玄，未若人身之隐玄，人身之隐玄，即天机也，玄功也。 故《阴符经》云：圣功生焉，．神明出焉！ 是知玄者炁之祖，道之真，天之色，法之妙，理之奥，水之本。 能穷其理，须造其玄，充尽其性，乃至於命。 试思混沌未分之初，年月日时安在哉？ 神是性兮炁是命，神不外驰炁自定。 能事毕矣！ 第七
chunks.translated_text:
The precious indeed!

The Classics say:
*"I do not see nor hear—
I do not know of the spirit,
Nor does the spirit depart from me,
Thus enduring with the Dao as long as ages."*

Then it speaks of *"my life is within me,
Not confined by Creation and Transformation."*[*]

The *Sutras of the Seven Primordials* say:
*"The Great Sovereign instructed the Seven Primordials:
'The Lower Primordial generates man,
From the *qi* of the *Yīnyūn* Primordial Unity,
The essence of the Primordial forming,
Endowed with life, one form complete.

The Three Primordials nurture,
The Nine *Qi* cover and protect.
Thus, the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper—
Every man possesses them fully.

The first nine stars, the *Potent Dragon* hidden,
Establish the *zi* position—
The Primordial Marshal of the Northern Dipper resides there!

Knowing this Primordial Spirit,
Cultivating its refinement and nourishment,
When form and spirit merge in unity,
The true essence manifests externally,
And the Mysterious Function is fulfilled.'*

The song declares:
*"Without stars, none bow to Heaven’s Enclosure—
Only the true mechanism lies in the dim and distant."*

Thus, the *Chénjī* (Polaris) is the *heart of Heaven*,
With rectitude as its square—
Facing the peak of *Kūnlún*,
Located in the *Purple Palace* of the Northern Pole, *Zhàngdōng*.

At the center of Heaven,
Within the Four Auxiliaries,
Beneath the *Huágài* (Celestial Canopy),
It is the *heart of Heaven*.

Still and unchanging—
It is the Master of the Primordial *Qi*,
The pivot and axis of Heaven and Earth."

The song declares:
*"The true Yang encloses the *qi* in ceaseless motion,
Ascending and descending through the Three Palaces in secret,
Life and death do not concern the floating world’s affairs—
Together they lead the Five Elders to the Golden Platform."*

The Five Elders are the spirits of the Five *Zàng* (Viscera),
Each man has them naturally—
The twelve nodes, the thirty-six minute bones,
Each pore aligned, each pulse connected,
Each node linked.

When cultivation reaches its peak,
Then *golden sinews and jade bones*,
The hundred limbs uncorrupted,
The pure *qi* ascends to become Heaven—
Pure yet purer, spirit yet more spirit,
Yang yet more Yang.

Man receives the Primordial *Qi* of Heaven and is born,
From the Three Pure Ones dividing their Three *Qi* into the Three Primordials—
The Upper *Dān Tiān* (Elixir Field) *Ní Wán Fǔ* (Mud Pellet Palace),
Ascending to correspond with the *Jade Purity* Green *Qi*;
The Middle *Dān Tiān* *Jiàng Gōng Fǔ* (Vermilion Palace),
Ascending to correspond with the *Upper Purity* White *Qi*;
The Lower *Dān Tiān* *Jiāo Huì Fǔ* (Convergence Palace),
Ascending to correspond with the *Supreme Purity* Yellow *Qi*.

This is what was spoken of earlier—
*"Preserving essence to enter the spirit."*

The *Supreme Purity* true soil,
Not the thick, heavy, and turbid earth of the world—
The transforming origin of all things.

Heaven unifies the Three Palaces as one,
Enduring through ten thousand ages without flaw.
The Three Palaces ascend and descend,
Ascending and descending without end—
This is what is meant!

To know one’s own Three Pure Ones—
Why seek above?
To know one’s own *Lǎo Jūn*—
Why search externally?

The *Supreme Sage* says:
*"Essence is my spirit,
*Qi* is my Dao.
Preserve essence and nurture *qi*,
Guard and uphold firm rectitude.

When Yin and Yang unite,
The true form is established—
And the transformation generates the Boy Child.
Test the breath at the nostrils—
It does not reach the ears.
Speak with the mouth—
It does not shake the lungs.
Then the elixir vein forms itself."*

*Qi* transforms into essence,
Essence transforms into spirit,
Spirit transforms into the Boy Child of the Heart.

Within my body reside the thirty-six thousand spirits,
Ever attending at my side.

If this is maintained over time,
Then one’s own Three Pure Ones, one’s own *Lǎo Jūn*, will appear!

Great are the mysteries of the Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars!
The Seven Stars’ true names and forms—
They are the Seven *Qi* of the Primordial Beginning,
Also the true *Qi* of the seven orifices within the human body.

The Yin-Yang Dipper Stars traverse the twelve *Zhī* (Earthly Branches) above,
The *zi-wǔ-ào-mǎo* (Child-Midday-Male Ox-Western Maid) palaces—
Within them lies the path to transcend the mundane and enter the sacred!

Thus, the fourth star *Wén Qū* (Literature Weaver),
Is the gate of Yin-Yang convergence—
The *zi-wǔ-ào-mǎo* positions where man is born.
The *ào-mǎo* (Male Ox-Western Maid) convergence occurs here,
And moreover, within Yin there is Yang,
Within Yang there is Yin—
This is called the *Two-Eight* Gate.

The *Dān* (Alchemy) Classics say:
*"The Dragon moves through the sixteen gates,
The Tiger hides in the nine and three doors—
Within the Heavenly Pass,
Its path is the Mysterious Extremity."*

Man can understand the mutual use of Yin and Yang,
The interplay of *Wū-Tù* (Heavenly Hare),
Thus the Dao’s *Qi* increases,
And the elixir spirit is accomplished.

The *Huáng Tíng* (Yellow Court) Classics say:
*"Within the Three Passes, essence, *Qi*, and spirit reside,
Within the Nine Profound, profound yet more profound.
The mouth is the Heavenly Pass—spirit’s mechanism,
The hands are the Human Pass—holding the flourishing and decline,
The feet are the Earthly Pass—life’s threshold.
And within the Dipper, the Three Passes are possessed—
The Heavenly Pass is at *wǔ*,
The Human Pass is at *ào-mǎo*,
The Earthly Pass is at *zi-wǔ*.
The Yin-Yang boundary positions,
The *ào-mǎo* doors where sun and moon enter and exit."*

Reflect now!
The Mysterious is the origin of all things,
Its principle inherent.

The hidden Mysterious of things,
Not as hidden as the Mysterious within the human body—
The Mysterious within the human body,
Is the Heavenly Mechanism,
The Mysterious Function.

Thus the *Yīn Fú* (Dark Seal) Classics say:
*"The sacred function is born from it,
The spirit and light emerge from it!"*

It is known:
The Mysterious is the origin of *Qi*,
The true of the Dao,
Heaven’s hue,
The marvel of the Law,
The profundity of principle,
Water’s source.

If one exhausts its principle,
Must construct its Mysterious,
Fulfill its nature,
Then reaching to its life.

Consider the beginning when *Hún Dùn* (Chaos) was undivided—
Where were the years, months, days, and hours?

Spirit is nature, *Qi* is life—
Spirit does not stray externally, *Qi* regulates itself.

The work is complete!

Huì-Yáng Zǐ said:
The Golden Elixir’s great medicine,
Indeed lies in what the Master transmits,
Yet also in Heaven’s favor.

Our Daoist Ancestor, the Most High Laozi,
In the *Dàodé Jīng* says:
*"Heaven’s Way has no favorites,
It always aids the virtuous."*

Our Ancestor, Master Wèi Bóyáng,
In the *Cāntóng Qì* says:
*"Heaven’s Way has no fixed path,
It is transmitted only to the worthy."*

Our Ancestor, Pure Yang True Person,
In the *Qìn Yuán Chūn* says:
*"The path of the humble gourd,
With three thousand deeds fulfilled,
Alone strides back to the clouds."*

Our Ancestor, Master Zhāng,
In his poem says:
*"The Great Medicine’s cultivation has ease and difficulty,
I know it depends on me and on Heaven—
If not for accumulated merit and hidden virtue,
Every move invites demons to obstruct."*

Again, in the *Xī Jiāng Yuè*:
*"If virtue surpasses eight hundred,
And hidden deeds reach three thousand,
Balancing all beings, kin, and grudges,
Only then does one fulfill the true wish of the Immortals."*

Indeed, the completion of the Golden Elixir
Is Heaven’s reward for the greatly virtuous.
If one does not cultivate hidden virtue
But merely seeks to steal the Great Dao,
Then Heaven will not aid them.
Even if they begin the practice,
Demons will soon arise to obstruct,
Or for years they toil in vain,
Only to blame the Dao or the Master,
And thus bring ruin upon themselves.

But if there are those who truly seek the Dao,
Ever mindful, compassionate, and aiding beings,
Rescuing the poor, relieving suffering,
Cherishing life, saving all sentient beings,
Encouraging loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and righteousness,
And performing all manner of hidden virtues—
Such as truly sparing life,
Or practicing skillful means to abstain from killing—
Then the Immortals will recommend them,
The Celestial Sovereign will bestow blessings.
They will swiftly find a clear Master,
Receive true transmission,
Begin cultivation with swift results,
Heaven aiding them, all spirits protecting,
No demonic obstructions, every action aligning with the True Principle.
In due time, the work will be complete,
Living in the world, eternally transcendent,
Ascending to the clouds,
Form and spirit both perfected,
Free and unbound.
Moreover, their blessings extend to descendants,
Enduring under the Dao’s shelter—
This, though the Master’s grace,
Is truly Heaven’s gift.

Twenty years of seeking the Dao,
Traversing ten thousand rivers and mountains,
No clear Master found—how could one rest?
How many times did I raise a single incense stick in prayer?

Fortunate to meet the Perfect One,
Who revealed the wondrous use of the Void,
The work accomplished in an instant,
Divine light radiant throughout the body.

---
*Xī Jiāng Yuè*
From death’s embrace, reborn again,
Returning to recognize the true self—
This journey’s boat, though bound for the coffin,
No eight winds can shake it.

A midnight moon wheel,
The Supreme Ultimate Diagram,
Ten thousand *lǐ* of clear azure,
Green peaks dissolving into clouds.

Joy supreme, joy supreme,
Common folk say it’s hard to find—
When asked what I do,
Silence is the Great Return.

---
*Jīn Dān Hé Cháo Hòu Tú*
*"Chisel open Chaos to reveal the Qiantang River,
The southern sky’s Yangtze as a silver screen—
Poets past and present have painted this scene,
Yet who can truly trace its origin?"*

Years pass, years return,
Days of *Gēng*, months of *Jiǎ*—
Why this sudden chaos?
Now it is revealed:
To know Heaven and Earth’s true source.

The Dao disperses, yet one name prevails—
The Five Phases in reverse,
Mutually arrayed in Heaven and Earth’s cycles.

The *Kǎn* Water flows backward toward the *Bǐng* Gate,
Following the waxing and waning of the moon,
Qi peaking at the Mid-Autumn Festival.

Gold can generate Water,
Doubly surging like a thousand layers of snow—
The Immortals’ wondrous use
Differs not from the tides.

This ode to the *Jiāngyuè* Moon,
Silently aligning with the Heavenly Cycle’s numbers,
Thus the Tidal Chart is recorded here,
To show those of shared intent.

It is known:
The Mysterious is the origin of *Qi*,
The true of the Dao,
Heaven’s hue,
The marvel of the Law,
The profundity of principle,
Water’s source.

If one exhausts its principle,
Must construct its Mysterious,
Fulfill its nature,
Then reaching to its life.

Consider the beginning when *Hún Dùn* (Chaos) was undivided—
Where were the years, months, days, and hours?

Spirit is nature, *Qi* is life—
Spirit does not stray externally, *Qi* regulates itself.

The work is complete!
The seventh.
